Stalemate

Chapter Info

Volume:

110

Chapter:

1113

Japanese Title:

STALEMATE（ステイルメイト）

Romanized Title:

Suteirumeito

Viz Title:

Stalemate

Pages:

19

Release Date:

April 29, 2024

WSJ Issue:

2024 Issue 22-23
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →
Chapter 1113 is titled "Stalemate".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Color Spread Cover Request: "The Straw Hats as chess pieces with Robin as the player" by PN Man Who Loves Yamato.

Short Summary[]

As the world prepares to listen to Dr. Vegapunk's upcoming speech, Sanji protects Franky and Bonney from Nusjuro with Oimo, Kashii, and Bonney backing him up. Mars learns the Den Den Mushi he found was a decoy. Saturn attacks Nami's group at the Thousand Sunny to murder Robin, but the other nearby Straw Hat Pirates members hold him back. As both Mars and York struggle to find the right Den Den Mushi without destroying the Power Plant, Vegapunk claims in his message that the world will sink into the Blue Sea.

Long Summary[]

Thirty seconds remain until the broadcast officially begins, and Mars sees that the source of the gurgling sound he heard earlier was Dr. Vegapunk's disconnected brain, which Mars wonders if it is the scientist's true form. Regardless, Mars walks over to the Broadcast Den Den Mushi and steps on it to break it, but to his shock and rage, though, he sees it was just an ordinary Den Den Mushi in disguise, meaning he was completely fooled into following a decoy, and the broadcast continues. Outraged, Mars transforms back into his Itsumade form and flies out of Punk Records cursing Dr. Vegapunk as the scientist finally begins his broadcast, with several people all over the world, including Kaya and her friends at Syrup Village, the citizens of Karakuri Island, the people of Torino Kingdom, and even the pirates of Hachinosu tuning in.

The other Elders ask Mars what he is doing and he tells them about the decoy, and now there is no way for them to currently stop the broadcast. He does say that they have no idea how much Dr. Vegapunk actually knows, or what he plans on saying, but York told him he wants to carry the torch of the Oharan scholars. In other words, he plans on finishing what Ohara started twenty-two years ago.

Back with Sanji, he hears Bonney crying for help, and he arrives at the coastline where he sees Nusjuro confront her and Franky, telling the former they will not let her have the Pacifista. Franky prepares to defend Bonney from Nusjuro's sword, but Sanji makes the heroic save himself, uppercutting Nusjuro with his foot. In response, the Elder turns into his full Bakotsu form and bites down on Sanji, causing him to let go of Dr. Vegapunk's body. Oimo and Kashii arrive on the scene and restrain Nusjuro, forcing him to let go of Sanji. Atlas grabs the Stella while Bonney uses Distorted Future to turn herself into a giant, intending to crush Nusjuro with her foot.

All the while, Dr. Vegapunk says in his message that he has committed two grave sins, and he will soon be executed for them, so he programmed the message to start playing when his heartbeat stops. His words shock the world as everyone starts fearing that Dr. Vegapunk is dead now, but he continues saying he does not want the people to assume the one who killed him is evil regardless of who they may be, and that he is in no position to judge right from wrong in this instance.

As for the Straw Hat crew on the Labophase, Saturn finally climbs all the way up and demands the pirates to stand aside so he can handle Dr. Vegapunk's message. He does spot Robin, and calls her the one Akainu let slip through his fingers. In turn, Robin recognizes his voice as one of the Five Elders from that day. Saturn immediately starts attacking as Nami grabs Robin and pushes her out of the way, while Zeus, Chopper, Usopp, and Brook do their best to resist him.

Growing frustrated, Mars decides it will be easier to completely destroy the lab because he cannot single out the origin of the broadcast, and York is struggling to figure out where the Stella would have put it herself. Saturn and Warcury, however, tell Mars that if he does, not only will they lose their military might, they will lose their ability to recreate the Mother Flame.

As for Dr. Vegapunk's message, he says that what he is about to say will be hard to believe and many may consider him crazy, but he feels he owes it to the people to let them know, and with that, he tells everyone that the world will soon sink into the Blue Sea.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • "Stalemate" is also the English title of Chapter 187.
  • The inside mechanics of Punk Records is shown for the first time, including the storage tank containing Vegapunk's brain.
  • Mars destroys the Transmission Den Den Mushi, but it turns out to be a decoy.
    • Mars attempts to locate the real Transmission Den Den Mushi around the Labophase, but is unable to find it due to an abundance of the snails.
  • The Five Elders suspect that Vegapunk intends to resume Clover's message about the Ancient Kingdom from twenty years ago.
  • Sanji defends Bonney and Franky from Nusjuro.
    • Oimo and Kashii arrive to aid Sanji.
    • Bonney uses her abilities to become gigantic and fight back against Nusjuro.
  • Saturn attempts to kill Robin as the present Straw Hat Pirates move to protect her.
  • Vegapunk's broadcasted message finally begins.
    • Vegapunk confirms that he is indeed dead, with the broadcast being programmed to activate with his passing.
    • Vegapunk mentions committing two "grave sins" that led to his execution, but does not specify which.
    • Vegapunk reveals that the world is set to sink into the Blue Sea.

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


Isn't Seijo Ishii supermarket wild?! Like the Kazuchee products or all the yakiimo and kimchi products!


成城石井てヤバくない!?かずチーとか焼き芋の色々とかキムチの色々とか･･･!!

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.

'''Chapter 1113''' is titled "Stalemate". 

==Cover Page==
[[Cover Page#Color Spread|Color Spread]] Cover Request: "The [[Straw Hat Pirates|Straw Hats]] as chess pieces with [[Nico Robin|Robin]] as the player" by PN Man Who Loves Yamato.

==Short Summary==
As the world prepares to listen to [[Vegapunk|Dr. Vegapunk]]'s upcoming speech, [[Sanji]] protects [[Franky]] and [[Jewelry Bonney|Bonney]] from [[Ethanbaron V. Nusjuro|Nusjuro]] with [[Oimo]], [[Kashii]], and Bonney backing him up. [[Marcus Mars|Mars]] learns the [[Den Den Mushi]] he found was a decoy. [[Jaygarcia Saturn|Saturn]] attacks [[Nami]]'s group at the [[Thousand Sunny]] to murder [[Nico Robin|Robin]], but the other nearby [[Straw Hat Pirates]] members hold him back. As both Mars and [[Vegapunk/York|York]] struggle to find the right Den Den Mushi without destroying the Power Plant, Vegapunk claims in his message that the world will sink into the [[Blue Sea]].

==Long Summary==
Thirty seconds remain until the broadcast officially begins, and [[Marcus Mars|Mars]] sees that the source of the gurgling sound he heard earlier was [[Vegapunk|Dr. Vegapunk's]] disconnected brain, which Mars wonders if it is the scientist's true form. Regardless, Mars walks over to the [[Den Den Mushi|Broadcast Den Den Mushi]] and steps on it to break it, but to his shock and rage, though, he sees it was just an ordinary Den Den Mushi in disguise, meaning he was completely fooled into following a decoy, and the broadcast continues. Outraged, Mars transforms back into his Itsumade form and flies out of [[Punk Records]] cursing Dr. Vegapunk as the scientist finally begins his broadcast, with several people all over the world, including [[Kaya]] and her friends at [[Syrup Village]], the citizens of [[Karakuri Island]], the people of [[Torino Kingdom]], and even the pirates of [[Hachinosu]] tuning in.

The other [[Five Elders|Elders]] ask Mars what he is doing and he tells them about the decoy, and now there is no way for them to currently stop the broadcast. He does say that they have no idea how much Dr. Vegapunk actually knows, or what he plans on saying, but [[Vegapunk/York|York]] told him he wants to carry the torch of the [[Ohara|Oharan]] scholars. In other words, he plans on finishing what Ohara started twenty-two years ago.

Back with [[Sanji]], he hears [[Jewelry Bonney|Bonney]] crying for help, and he arrives at the coastline where he sees [[Ethanbaron V. Nusjuro|Nusjuro]] confront her and [[Franky]], telling the former they will not let her have the [[Pacifista]]. Franky prepares to defend Bonney from Nusjuro's sword, but Sanji makes the heroic save himself, uppercutting Nusjuro with his foot. In response, the Elder turns into his full Bakotsu form and bites down on Sanji, causing him to let go of Dr. Vegapunk's body. [[Oimo]] and [[Kashii]] arrive on the scene and restrain Nusjuro, forcing him to let go of Sanji. [[Vegapunk/Atlas|Atlas]] grabs the Stella while Bonney uses ''Distorted Future'' to turn herself into a giant, intending to crush Nusjuro with her foot.

All the while, Dr. Vegapunk says in his message that he has committed two grave sins, and he will soon be executed for them, so he programmed the message to start playing when his heartbeat stops. His words shock the [[world]] as everyone starts fearing that Dr. Vegapunk is dead now, but he continues saying he does not want the people to assume the one who killed him is evil regardless of who they may be, and that he is in no position to judge right from wrong in this instance.

As for the [[Straw Hat Pirates|Straw Hat crew]] on the Labophase, [[Jaygarcia Saturn|Saturn]] finally climbs all the way up and demands the pirates to stand aside so he can handle Dr. Vegapunk's message. He does spot [[Nico Robin|Robin]], and calls her the one [[Sakazuki|Akainu]] let slip through his fingers. In turn, Robin recognizes his voice as one of the Five Elders from that day. Saturn immediately starts attacking as [[Nami]] grabs Robin and pushes her out of the way, while [[Zeus]], [[Tony Tony Chopper|Chopper]], [[Usopp]], and [[Brook]] do their best to resist him.

Growing frustrated, Mars decides it will be easier to completely destroy the lab because he cannot single out the origin of the broadcast, and York is struggling to figure out where the Stella would have put it herself. Saturn and [[Topman Warcury|Warcury]], however, tell Mars that if he does, not only will they lose their military might, they will lose their ability to recreate the [[Mother Flame]].

As for Dr. Vegapunk's message, he says that what he is about to say will be hard to believe and many may consider him crazy, but he feels he owes it to the people to let them know, and with that, he tells everyone that the world will soon sink into the [[Blue Sea]].

==Quick References==
===Chapter Notes===
*"Stalemate" is also the English title of [[Chapter 187]].
*The inside mechanics of [[Punk Records]] is shown for the first time, including the storage tank containing [[Vegapunk]]'s [[Nomi Nomi no Mi|brain]].

**Mars attempts to locate the real Transmission Den Den Mushi around the Labophase, but is unable to find it due to an abundance of the snails.

**[[Oimo]] and [[Kashii]] arrive to aid Sanji.
**Bonney uses her [[Toshi Toshi no Mi|abilities]] to become gigantic and fight back against Nusjuro.
*[[Jaygarcia Saturn|Saturn]] attempts to kill [[Nico Robin|Robin]] as the present [[Straw Hat Pirates]] move to protect her.
*Vegapunk's broadcasted message finally begins.
**Vegapunk confirms that he is indeed dead, with the broadcast being programmed to activate with his passing.
**Vegapunk mentions committing two "grave sins" that led to his execution, but does not specify which.
**Vegapunk reveals that the [[world]] is set to sink into the [[Blue Sea]].
